summary: Interactive romantic web page to ask Tasbiha to be Valentine with Yes/No buttons, playful evasive No button, and showing a provided image upon Yes; runs on mobile/iPad Chrome using HTML/CSS/JS.
architectural_notes: Single-page static web app (HTML/CSS/JS) optimized for mobile/iPad Chrome touch and mouse interactions

existing_features.title: Create a single-screen romantic Valentine prompt page addressed to “Tasbiha” with the sole purpose of asking her to be the user’s Valentine, showing exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”.

Implement a playful interaction where the “No” button moves away when the pointer hovers over it (or when a touch interaction attempts to target it), making it effectively impossible to click/tap “No” on desktop and mobile.
On clicking/tapping “Yes”, transition the UI to a celebratory/romantic confirmation state and display the provided image exactly as given (no edits or transformations to the image content).
Apply a cohesive romantic theme using a pink and white color scheme, with responsive layout and touch-friendly sizing so it runs well in Chrome on iPad and phones.
Do not require any backend features for this experience; implement it fully in the frontend as a lightweight, single-page interaction.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a simple romantic-themed interactive Valentine web page addressing Tasbiha with Yes/No choices
Implement evasive 'No' button that moves away on hover to prevent clicking
On 'Yes' click, display the user-provided image exactly as given and keep a pink/white romantic theme
Ensure the page runs easily on iPad/phone in Chrome using only HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
